item.title: Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Begins After 11th-Hour Talks Over Hostages
item.description: Qatar says pause in fighting will be followed by an exchange of hostages and prisoners.

item.title: Nissan Motor to Invest Over $2 Billion in EV, Battery Business in U.K.
item.description: Nissan Motor plans to invest up to $2.39 billion in electric vehicles, battery production and infrastructure in the U.K.

item.title: USD/JPY's Corrective Rebound Has Started to Show Exhaustion Signs
item.description: The dollar was marginally lower as it struggles to recover from a slump triggered by the October inflation data.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise, Market Awaits German Ifo Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose in early trading as ECB officials pushed back against rate cut expectations and after Germany announced a suspension of the debt brake for 2023.

item.title: China Names Zhu Hexin as Party Chief of Forex Regulator
item.description: Veteran banker Zhu Hexin has been named as the new Communist Party chief of China’s foreign-exchange regulator, succeeding Pan Gongsheng, who heads up the country’s central bank.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.5%, Buoyed by Softer-Than-Expected Core CPI, JPY Weakness
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average rose 0.5% to close at 33625.53, buoyed by Japan’s softer-than-expected October core CPI and JPY weakness.

item.title: Novo Nordisk to Boost Wegovy Production in France
item.description: Novo Nordisk said it will invest more than $2 billion in its French production site as it seeks to meet rising demand for its blockbuster obesity and diabetes treatments.

item.title: LG Electronics Unveils Restructuring to Boost Global Competitiveness
item.description: LG Electronics will set up a new sales and marketing entity to oversee international business, part of a series of restructuring moves to boost its competitiveness and growth.

item.title: Satellite Images Indicate China Is Upgrading Its Air Bases for War
item.description: Air bases along China’s southeastern coast facing Taiwan have undergone significant infrastructure upgrades in recent years. Analysts say these changes are a sign of Beijing’s preparations for a conflict over Taiwan.

item.title: Voters See American Dream Slipping Out of Reach, WSJ/NORC Poll Shows
item.description: Fewer believe that anyone who works hard can get ahead.

item.title: U.S. markets were closed for the Thanksgiving Day holiday. In trading elsewhere, Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index advanced 1% and the Shanghai Composite gained 0.6%. Japan was closed for a holiday.
item.description: U.S. markets were closed for the Thanksgiving Day holiday. In trading elsewhere, Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index advanced 1% and the Shanghai Composite gained 0.6%. Japan was closed for a holiday.

item.title: China provided the WHO with data on a pneumonia outbreak among children in the country after the agency made an unusual public request for the information, renewing questions about Beijing's transparency on public health.
item.description: China provided the WHO with data on a pneumonia outbreak among children in the country after the agency made an unusual public request for the information, renewing questions about Beijing’s transparency on public health.

item.title: The American dream---the proposition that anyone who works hard can get ahead, regardless of background---has slipped out of reach in the minds of many Americans, according to a new survey.
item.description: The American dream—the proposition that anyone who works hard can get ahead, regardless of background—has slipped out of reach in the minds of many Americans, according to a new survey.

item.title: The electoral win by Geert Wilders, the Dutch far-right leader who has championed draconian policies against immigration and Islam, reflects how intractable the issue of migration remains in Europe and in much of the West.
item.description: The electoral win by Geert Wilders, the Dutch far-right leader who has championed draconian policies against immigration and Islam, reflects how intractable the issue of migration remains in Europe and in much of the West.

item.title: General Motors' Cruise driverless-car unit plans to eventually reintroduce itsrobotaxi service following safety mishaps, but will narrow the focus to one city and shelve plans for the Origin, a GM-built driverless taxi.
item.description: General Motors’ Cruise driverless-car unit plans to eventually reintroduce its robotaxi service following safety mishaps, but will narrow the focus to one city and shelve plans for the Origin, a GM-built driverless taxi.

item.title: United Airlines is considering using passenger information to help brands serve targeted ads to its customers, joining a growing number of companies weighing user data for the purpose.
item.description: United Airlines is considering using passenger information to help brands serve targeted ads to its customers, joining a growing number of companies weighing user data for the purpose.

item.title: Firearms maker Colt sought to block Vista Outdoor's proposed merger with a Czech industrial company, making an unsolicited offer to acquire the U.S.-based sporting- and outdoor-goods firm.
item.description: Firearms maker Colt sought to block Vista Outdoor’s proposed merger with a Czech industrial company, making an unsolicited offer to acquire the U.S.-based sporting- and outdoor-goods firm.

item.title: The EU will help Finland bolster its borders following a recent surge of migrants trying to enter the country from Russia, which Helsinki has accused of facilitating their passage.
item.description: The EU will help Finland bolster its borders following a recent surge of migrants trying to enter the country from Russia, which Helsinki has accused of facilitating their passage.

item.title: The Pritzker Organization, the family office of Hyatt Hotels executive chairman Thomas Pritzker, started a venture division to invest in early-stage companies with a $190 million fund.
item.description: The Pritzker Organization, the family office of Hyatt Hotels executive chairman Thomas Pritzker, started a venture division to invest in early-stage companies with a $190 million fund.

item.title: U.S. air-safety regulators cleared Boeing to begin key flight tests on its 737 MAX 10 jet, a milestone toward preparing the plane for commercial service.
item.description: U.S. air-safety regulators cleared Boeing to begin key flight tests on its 737 MAX 10 jet, a milestone toward preparing the plane for commercial service.
